page.title: 02TRANSPORT(A1)
page.content: ]History of: The Great North Road has been an important road since the Sixteenth century.At this time horse drawn wagons,stage_coaches and people on foot,used this route.Travelling any distance was time consuming and involved many stops.Consequently there were many inns,and staging points along this road.Towns grew up around these points (e.g.Grantham.) Legend has it that Dick Turpin used this road to rob stage_coaches,and probably used it for his marathon ride from London to York in 48 hours. The road has grown from a narrow lane to a four lane cariageway this century.By_passes were built aound the main towns (@1960 ) to stop traffic congestion.Some parts of the A1 are now motorway(Stevenage to london).
